subject: Communication
title: Listening Up: How Leaders Hear Dissent
description: One-minute skill: Listening Up: How Leaders Hear Dissent.

hook.text: A CEO asks for honest feedback. Everyone says 'great job.' Is the work really that good â€” or is everyone too afraid to.

buildup.text: Power dynamics filter what leaders hear. Subordinates self-censor, sugarcoat, and tell leaders what they want to hear.

discovery.text: Ethan Burris found that leaders who actively seek dissent and thank dissenters receive 40% more useful information.

twist.text: The first time a leader punishes dissent, it takes months to rebuild the willingness to speak up.

climax.text: The best leaders create 'safe to fail' zones: regular forums where critical feedback is expected, welcomed, and.

punchline.text: If everyone agrees with the leader, the leader isn't listening hard enough.

quiz.question: How much more useful information do leaders who actively seek dissent receive?
